intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gods...these stairs seem to go on forever.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Indeed. But what did you expect? This is the Eternal Stairway. Not to worry—we've almost reached the halfway point.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Right. I suppose there is no Five-Minute Stairway we could have taken instead.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin, please be silent for a moment...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yeah, that fell a bit flat. Sorry.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: No, that's not it. I'm sensing an unusual presence. I think we're being followed.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: How is that possible? I haven't seen any signs of life...

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Attention! Whoever you are! Show yourself now if you wish to avoid conflict!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Faceless! Where did they come from?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: How strange. I expected humans. The Faceless usually aren't this stealthy. In any case, we have no time to spare. Let's take them out!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Azura, can you please guard Sakura while we deal with this?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes, of course.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Be careful, Corrin!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Are you ready, Kaze? Let's do this.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: You can count on me. Hyah!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Stand aside or be destroyed!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: All right, just a few more standing...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Everyone, hold! Something isn't right.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: What's the matter, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: These aren't Faceless—they're people! Gods! What have we done?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I'm afraid you're right. I recognize their clothing. These people are from the Wind Tribe.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't understand. A moment ago, this person right here was a Faceless monster!
Ahahaha...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Who's there? Show yourself at once!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Good day, Princeling/Princess. Did you enjoy my magic trick?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Iago! What have you done?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: I didn't do a thing! You're the one who struck down these poor villagers.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Why? What could you possibly have to gain...

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Don't you see? This is just the beginning. Now that you're with the Hoshidans, anything is fair game. Oh, your ignorance does tickle me. Bwahahah!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: And he's gone.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: This puts us in an unfortunate position, to say the least. The route ahead takes us thorugh Wind Tribe territory. And we're going to have a hard time explaining what just happened.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Who was that maniac, anyway? Do you know him, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes. His name is Iago. King Garon's right-hand man. I didn't know he was capable of this sort of thing. He probably made US appear to be Faceless to those poor villagers...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Well, he did do us one favor. He revealed himself to us as an enemy. I'm sure we'll have to go through him to get to King Garon.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, I would expect so...

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: We've arrived. This is the Wind Tribe Village we must pass through. Lord/Lady Corrin, are you certain you want to approach the village directly?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes. Trying to sneak around will only makes us seem more suspicious. Surely they'll understand that we mean them no harm.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: I'm not as optimistic, but I will trust your judgment. Ah, it looks as though the decision has been made for us...

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Here they are! The savages who attacked our people!

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Prepare to die.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Please wait! We can explain. It is true that we fought with some of your people. But we were deceived by an enemy from Nohr.

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Please. How stupid do you think we are?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: This is going well.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Right. Any ideas?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Excuse me! Can I have everyone's attention?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Sakura! Be careful!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Please forgive us. We are so s-sorry to have hurt your people. But you must understand that they appeared before us as Faceless!

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Lady Sakura? You're with these brigands?

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Yeah, what's going on here?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Please. You must believe us.

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Lady Azura is with them too! Maybe they are telling the truth...

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Hold that thought. Have you considered that THIS might be a trap? Either way, we can't make this decision ourselves. Let's see what Chief Fuga has to say.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very well. We would be happy to speak with your Chief Fuga.

intro.speaker: Tribalist
intro.line: Speak? Bwahaha! Somehow I don't think that's what the chief will have in mind.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Be careful, Corrin. I believe your strategy is sage, but... We are putting ourselves in a higly vulnerable position.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, I'm well aware of that. But what choice do we have?

battle.speaker: Fuga
battle.line: So. You've made it this far.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: You must be Chief Fuga. Please, allow me to explain—

battle.speaker: Fuga
battle.line: No. You must earn the right to explain. Show me that you fight with honor!

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Hinoka! What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinoka
recruit-talk.line: I could ask you the same question, Corrin.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Yes, well... A lot has happened. I thought you were in the capital.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinoka
recruit-talk.line: Yes, I was. But I decided to try to catch up to Ryoma and Takumi on their way to Izumo.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Ah. Well, it's good that we met up...but I have some bad news. Ryoma and Takumi are missing. We're trying to track them down.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinoka
recruit-talk.line: Missing? Oh gods... They are not the sort of men that simply go missing. What has happened to them, Corrin?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: We don't know. And we've run into a few problems of our own along the way...

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinoka
recruit-talk.line: Yes, I can see that. I thought the Wind Tribe was neutral. Why are we fighting?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: It's a long story, but I believe that we'll be able to explain ourselves to the chief. Will you join us? We could certainly use a little help.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hinoka
recruit-talk.line: Of course! Although, a LITTLE help is about all you'll get from these two...

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: What do you mean by that? Never mind... I'm just happy to have you all on our side. Let's do this!

boss.speaker: Fuga
boss.line: You've shown some fortitude. Now show me that you're worthy of my attention!

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Bahaha! Well done. I suppose I shouldn't have underestimated one who carries the sacred Yato blade. Now, I will gladly hear an explanation for the unprovoked attack on my people.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, of course. Wait—what do you know of my blade?

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Ah, King Sumeragi and I were good friends. I learned much about the history of that weapon from him. I also shared concern for its future, which is why it was necessary for me to test you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Test me? How so?

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Corrin, the blade you possess has the power to link the Seal of Flames. In the wrong hands, it could unleash enough power to end the world. That's why I wanted to see for myself if you are indeed the right person to handle it.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I see. And what of the villagers we wounded?

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: I already knew that you and your associates were acting in good faith. For what reason would Hoshidan royalty attack a stranger? And then allow her party to be peacefully captured by the stranger's tribe? No, I was well aware that something was amiss.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well, thank you for believing in us. This is the first good news we've had in some time, I'm afraid.

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Oh? Please, I would gladly hear your full story. But let us freshen up from the battle and sit down to a proper meal first.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I appreciate the invitation—and believe me, a bit of rest and a meal are what we need... But we're in search of Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi. We haven't a moment to spare.

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: I see. Then you must be on your way. Best of luck.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well, I suppose that worked out better than it could have...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. I'm glad to know we can still count the Wind Tribe among our friends.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm still puzzling a bit over what Fuga said about my blade. Do you know anything about the Seal of Flames?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No. But I found it curious that he described "linking" the seal. Could there be more than one Seal of Flames? If so, could there be more than one sacred blade out there? It is a troubling idea. What if our enemies already possess a similar weapon?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Right. That is a troubling thought. But let's focus on the problems in front of us before inventing new ones.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: You're right, Corrin. I suppose I'm getting carried away.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Perhaps we've spoken too soon. Here comes Chief Fuga, and he appears to be in a hurry.

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Corrin! Please wait a moment.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: How can we help you, Chief? Is everything OK?

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Yes, yes, thank you. It occurred to me that we might be able to make a mutually beneficial arrangement. You are in need of all the men and women you can get. And we have a skilled diviner who could use some real-world experience. His name is Hayato, and he would like to offer his services to your party.

end.speaker: Hayato
end.line: Good day.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Um...

end.speaker: Hayato
end.line: Is there a problem?

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Please! Don't judge him by his youthful appearance. Hayato has mastered a number of unique skills that make him invaluable.

end.speaker: Hayato
end.line: I don't mean to sound conceited, but... You would be lucky to have me on your team.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well! I certainly won't turn down your assistance at a time like this.

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Splendid. I hope he makes a valuable addition to your team. And as for you, Hayato, I'm glad to finally be able to offer you this chance to travel.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Travel? I hope you both realize that this isn't exactly a vacation...

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Of course. It's just that Hayato has not had much opportunity to leave the village. In addition to helping you, he will be exploring the world for the first time.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I see. I think I understand exactly how he feels. After all, I spent most of my childhood locked in a Nohrian castle.

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: Well, then I'm sure you two will have a lot to talk about. And I trust you'll take good care of our Hayato.

end.speaker: Hayato
end.line: Chief! Must I remind you again that I am no longer a child?

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: You're right, you're right. I must admit that I still feel a bit protective at times...

end.speaker: Hayato
end.line: Dad! I mean...Chief! Lord/Lady Corrin, he's not my dad. He's just looked after me since I was a child.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's OK. I understand. Anyway...we should get going. Welcome aboard, Hayato. And thank you for everything, Chief Fuga.

end.speaker: Fuga
end.line: No need to thank me. Please feel free to come back here anytime you'd like. I'm proud to have met the one whom the sacred Yato chose. We shall meet again.
